intro: Claytonia bifida, commonly known as the twin-leaf springbeauty, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive paired leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a short growing season, blooming in early spring before the canopy of trees fully develops. Claytonia bifida is often found in the eastern United States and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
